Why do we have Black Breastfeeding Week?

Here‚Äôs why:

Black Breastfeeding Week was created because of the long-standing racial disparities seen in breastfeeding rates. CDC data shows that 75% of white women versus 58.9% of black women have ever breastfed.

The BBW website states, ‚ÄúThe fact that racial disparity in initiation and even bigger one for duration has lingered for so long is reason enough to take 7 days to focus on the issue.‚Äù

Visit our website for a breakdown of the top 5 reasons why we need BBW:
https://buff.ly/31oQq0F

This week, we will be sharing our support for #BBW20 on all our social media channels! Follow us for updates!

It's Camping Week at Help Me Grow-Allegan. Did you know there are many important reasons why children should GO OUT & PLAY!

Outdoor play:
1. Offers children an opportunity to be more creative.
2. Lets children do what they are interested in: run, learn sports, climb, talk and look at bugs.
3. Provides children with hands-on learning through being able to manipulate natural materials like dirt, leaves, rocks and bugs.
4. Provides a physical outlet for pent up energy. Physical exercise can reduce stress levels and put children in a calm state so they are more receptive to teacher led indoor lessons.
5. Provides children with time to practice critical social skills such as negotiating who is on a team, making up rules for a game, taking turns on the slide and talking with friends about life (‚ÄúWho‚Äôs coming to your birthday party?‚Äù ‚ÄúHow mean is your sister?‚Äù).
6. Improves children‚Äôs mental health by giving them a chance to rejuvenate, relax and return to class with renewed interest.

Read more about Outdoor Play at https://www.canr.msu.edu/news/go_out_and_play

Meet our amazing Wayland Family Coach-
"Hello, my name is Laurie Zywiczynski, Family Coach for Wayland Union Schools. I have worked with families with young children at WUS since 2004. Prior to this I worked as a Parent Educator for the Parents as Teachers program in the WUS district for two years. I have an associates degree in Early Childhood Education from GRCC and a B.S. from Western Michigan University. I enjoy helping families get connected to our district and to area resources, especially when they need assistance with entering preschool or kindergarten.
